Domains and/or Subdomains that are allow: Domains and/or Subdomains that are allowed to use GitScrum White Label.
Add a CNAME record to your domain's DNS: Add a CNAME record to your domain's DNS records
To add the CNAME record to your domain h: To add the CNAME record to your domain host, follow the steps below. See your domain host’s documentation for more specific instructions.
1. Go to your domain’s DNS records: 1. Go to your domain’s DNS records
2. Add a record to your DNS settings, se: 2. Add a record to your DNS settings, selecting CNAME as the record type
3. Return to the first window or tab and: 3. Return to the first window or tab and copy the contents of the Label/Host field
4. Paste the copied contents into the La: 4. Paste the copied contents into the Label or Host field with your DNS records
5. Return to the first window or tab and: 5. Return to the first window or tab and copy the contents of the Destination/Target field
6. Paste the copied contents into the De: 6. Paste the copied contents into the Destination or Target field with your DNS records
Your record should look similar to one o: Your record should look similar to one of the tables below
CNAME_Text1: CNAME record changes can take up to 72 hours to go into effect, but typically they happen much sooner.
You can upload a logo to replace the Git: You can upload a logo to replace the GitScrum Logo in Header of your company. This is a great way to promote your brand.
We recommend using image files: of less: We recommend using image files: of less than 500 KB and 122 (width) x 22 (height) pixels for best results.

UserStory_Text1: User stories are short, simple descriptions of a feature told from the perspective of the person who desires the new capability, usually a user or customer of the system.They typically follow a simple template:
UserStory_Text2: A user story is a tool used in Agile software development to capture a description of a software feature from an end - user perspective.The user story describes the type of user, what they want and why. A user story helps to create a simplified description of a requirement.
UserStory_Text3: Confirmation of requirement understanding and decide about acceptance of iteration deliverable
Project_Details_Text: When a project is Public, anyone can access the project and view their tasks. Public projects are in read - only mode for everyone.
Project_Details_Text_2: You can upload a logo image to appear in sidebar of your project. This is a great way to promote your brand on your project. We recommend using image files of less than 500 KB and between 128 x 128 pixels for best results.
Sprint_Text1: Sprint is one timeboxed iteration of a continuous development cycle. Within a Sprint, planned amount of work has to be completed by the team and made ready for review.
Sprint_Text2: Sprint literal meaning is a short race at full speed. Accordingly, teams usually define a short duration of a Sprint up to 2-4 weeks.
Sprint_Text3: The Sprint Goal is an objective set for the Sprint that can be met through the implementation of Product Backlog.It provides guidance to the Development Team on why it is building the Increment.As the Development Team works, it does so with the Sprint Goal always in mind.
or click to select a file from your comp: or click to select a file from your computer
Do you really want to delete?: Do you really want to delete?
You must fill in the task title: You must fill in the task title
ProjectModal_Text2: When a project is marked as “public” anyone can access
ProjectModal_Text3: every section of your project and view its content. The public projects are in read-only mode for everybody. Projects that are public can be used to showcase your work and expose your project plan, project backlog and current development status.
ProjectModal_Text4: are accessible only by the individuals who are granted access by the project administrators.Only those who are members of the project can view its content.
ProjectModal_Text5: A project’s visibility defines if a GitScrum user can or not access your project.If the setting was defined as a public project, any GitScrum user can see that project. Therefore, if you wish to have more privacy and secrecy, choose to create a private project, and like that, only those that you allow will be able to access your project.
